info.description:
This documentation describes Kalshi's rest API for market makers

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->
info.title: Kalshi API.

get.description: End-point for listing / discovering markets on Kalshi with data that is cached and so slightly lagged.

End-point for getting data about a specific market with data that is cached and so slightly lagged.

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the target market.

parameters.description: Should be filled with the id of the target market
parameters.name: market_id

get.description:
End-point for getting the statistics history for a market with data that is cached and so slightly lagged.

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the target market.
The last_seen_ts parameter is optional, and will restrict statistics to those after provided timestamp.
The last_seen_ts is inclusive, which means a market history point at last_seen_ts will be returned

parameters.description: Should be filled with the id of the target market
parameters.name: market_id

parameters.description: If provided, restricts history to trades starting from lastSeenTs
parameters.name: last_seen_ts

get.description:
End-point for getting data about a specific market with data that is cached and so slightly lagged.

The value for the ticker_name path parameter should match the ticker_name value of the target market.

parameters.description: Should be filled with the ticker name of the target market
parameters.name: ticker_name

get.description: End-point for getting the exchange status

post.description: End-point to start a rest session with Kalshi.
End-point to terminates your session with Kalshi.

get.description: End-point for listing / discovering markets on Kalshi.

End-point for getting data about a specific market.

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the target market.

parameters.description: Should be filled with the id of the target market
parameters.name: market_id

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the target market.

parameters.description: Should be filled with the id of the target market
parameters.name: market_id

End-point for getting the statistics history for a market.

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the target market.
The last_seen_ts parameter is optional, and will restrict statistics to those after provided timestamp.
The last_seen_ts is inclusive, which means a market history point at last_seen_ts will be returned

parameters.description: Should be filled with the id of the target market
parameters.name: market_id

parameters.description: If provided, restricts history to trades starting from lastSeenTs

get.description:
End-point for getting data about a specific market based on its ticker.

The value for the ticker_name path parameter should match the ticker_name value of the target market.

parameters.description: Should be filled with the ticker name of the target market
parameters.name: ticker_name

post.description:
End-point to request a password reset email link.

To be used in case you forget your password.

put.description:
End-point to finish the password reset flow.

The code param on the path should be filled with the verification code sent by email.

parameters.description: Should be filled with the verification code received on the sign-up email.
parameters.name: code

requestBody.description: Data required to finish a password reset.

get.description: End-point for getting data about a ranged market

parameters.description: Should be filled in with a ranged market id
parameters.name: ranged_market_id

get.description: End-point for getting data about a ranged market by its ticker

parameters.description: Should be the ticker of the ranged market
parameters.name: ticker

get.description: End-point for getting all trades for all markets.

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades during a certain day. Format: YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: trades_date

parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Parameter to specify which page of the results should be retrieved
parameters.name: page_number

get.description:
End-point for retrieving the logged in user's profile.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: Should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
End-point for getting the logged in user's important past actions and events related to the user's positions.

This contains entries for user's explicit actions but also for market events.

There will be entries for:

submitting, editing / canceling orders
requesting deposits and withdrawals
trade execution (order matching)
market settlements on markets where you have a position

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the
last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: If true the response should include deposit entries
parameters.name: ShouldReturnDeposits

parameters.description: If true the response should include withdrawal entries
parameters.name: ShouldReturnWithdrawals

parameters.description: If true the response should include order entries
parameters.name: ShouldReturnOrders

parameters.description: If true the response should include settlement entries
parameters.name: ShouldReturnSettlements

parameters.description: If true the response should include trade entries
parameters.name: ShouldReturnTrades

parameters.description: Restricts the response to a return the first "limit" amount of acct history items
parameters.name: Limit

get.description:
End-point for getting the balance of the logged in user.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: Should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
End-point for getting notifications for the current logged in user.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Page of the results
parameters.name: page_number

put.description:
End-point for marking a notification as read.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

The value for the notification_id path parameter should match the notification_id value of the notification to be marked as read.

parameters.description: user_id should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: notification_id should be filled with the id of the notification to be mark as read
parameters.name: notification_id

get.description:
End-point for getting e-mail subscription mode for the current user.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
End-point for getting all orders for the logged in user.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders in a single market
parameters.name: market_id

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders in a single direction (yes or no)
parameters.name: is_yes

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a minimum price
parameters.name: min_price

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a maximum price
parameters.name: max_price

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a minimum place count
parameters.name: min_place_count

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a maximum place count
parameters.name: max_place_count

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a minimum initial count
parameters.name: min_initial_count

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a maximum initial count
parameters.name: max_initial_count

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a minimum remaining resting contracts count
parameters.name: min_remaining_count

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders within a maximum remaining resting contracts count
parameters.name: max_remaining_count

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders after a timestamp
parameters.name: min_date

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders before a timestamp
parameters.name: max_date

parameters.description: If true, gets the queue placement for every resting order returned
parameters.name: get_queue_position

parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders that have a certain status: resting, canceled, or executed

parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page

parameters.description: Parameter to specify which page of the results should be retrieved

post.description:
End-point for submitting orders in a market.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

delete.description:
End-point for canceling orders.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).
The value for the order_id should match the id field of the order you want to decrease.
Commonly delete end-points return 204 status with no body content on success.
But we can't completely delete the order, as it may be partially filled already.
So what the delete end-point does is just reducing the order completely zeroing the remaining resting contracts on it.
The zeroed order is returned on the response payload, as a form of validation for the client.

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: This order_id should be filled with the id of the order to be decrease
parameters.name: order_id

post.description:
End-point for decreasing the number of contracts on orders. This is the only kind of edit we support on orders.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

The value for the order_id should match the id field of the order you want to decrease.

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: This order_id should be filled with the id of the order to be decrease
parameters.name: order_id

put.description:
End-point for updating logged-in user password.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
End-point for getting the logged in user's portfolio historical track.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
End-point for getting all market positions for the logged in user.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: Should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
End-point for getting the market positions for the logged in user, in a specific market.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the target market.

parameters.description: Should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: Should be filled with the id of the target market
parameters.name: market_id

put.description:
End-point for changing e-mail subscription mode for the current user.

This end-point is very useful for users that have a large volume of orders and don't want to be email notified whenever an order is submitted / edited / canceled or matches.

This is specially useful for Market Makers.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: Should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
End-point for getting all trades for the logged in user.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: This parameter should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades in a specific market.
parameters.name: market_id

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades related to a specific order.
parameters.name: order_id

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades within a minimum price.
parameters.name: MinPrice

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades within a maximum price.
parameters.name: MaxPrice

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades within a minimum contracts count.
parameters.name: MinCount

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades within a maximum contracts count.
parameters.name: max_count

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades after a timestamp.
parameters.name: min_date

parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades before a timestamp.
parameters.name: max_date

parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Parameter to specify which page of the results should be retrieved
parameters.name: page_number

get.description:
End-point for getting the market watchlist for the logged in user.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

parameters.description: Should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

delete.description:
End-point for removing a market from the logged in user's watchlist.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the market to be added.

parameters.description: Should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: Should be filled with the id of the target market
parameters.name: market_id

put.description:
End-point for adding a market to the logged in user's watchlist.

The value for the user_id path parameter should match the user_id value returned on the response for the last login request (POST /log_in).

The value for the market_id path parameter should match the id value of the market to be added.

parameters.description: user_id should be filled with your user_id provided on log_in
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: market_id should be filled with the id of the market to be added to the watchlist
parameters.name: market_id

EmptyResponse.description: No fields are returned on the response.

JSONError.description: JSONError is a generic structure for API error responses.

Set-Cookie.description: Access token is set on a cookie named 'sessions' as well

type.description: Type of entry, one of Deposit, Withdrawal, Order, or Settlement

BankAccountDetails.description:
Encapsulates meta-data of bank accounts.

This is not stored within Kalshi, it is always proxied from the clearing house.
BankAccountDetails.title: BankAccountDetails

subscription_level.description: Specifies the subscription level for email notifications its values can be: "none", "basic" or "all"

user_id.description: UserUUID for your user. You can get this from the password reset link query parameter.

email.description: A valid email for the new user.

password.description: Password for the new user account.

CreateUserRequest.title: Request for creating a new user.

DepositHistory.description: Represents a deposit account history item
DepositHistory.title: DepositHistory

deposits.description: List of previous deposits for the user

withdrawals.description: List of previous withdrawals for the user

email.description: Email should be used as login identification credentials.

password.description: Password defined in the first step of the sign-up.

access_level.description: Access level, to limit the access that applicants have

token.description: Access token for an member role session in the api

user_id.description: Your user_id, this will be required in all requests under the /users prefix

MarketPosition.description: MarketPosition is your accumulated position on a specific market considering all orders and trades.
MarketPosition.title: MarketPosition

Order.description:
Represents user orders in the api.

When an order is matched multiple trades can be created this can be tracked by looking into the trade.order_id field.
Order.title: Order

OrderBook.description:
OrderBook
Contains the number of pending resting order for each price on a specific market.

PortfolioMeasurement.description: Portfolio measurement is simply a snapshot of the portfolio of a user on a timestamp.

cumulative_number_settlements.description: Count of settlements member has had from account creation to timestamp (inclusive)

reason.description: Reason for the portfolio value change, if applicable

ts.description: Timestamp of the read in UNIX timestamp. (https://www.unixtimestamp.com/)

PortfolioMeasurement.title: PortfolioMeasurement

PriceLevel.description:
PriceLevel
It is the state of a the market with respect to a specific price.
It is represented as an array of 2 integer values.
The first one is the price value and the second one is the total number of resting contract at that price among all orders.
Minimum length: 2
Maximum length: 2
Items.0.Minimum: 1
Items.0.Maximum: 99
Items.1.Minimum: 0
Example: [30, 50] means there are 50 resting

PublicTrade.description:
Represents a trade that can be displayed publicly. This does not include maker and taker information.

A trade is created whenever an order is fully or partially matched.
PublicTrade.title: PublicTrade

email.description: Email used to create your account

User.description: Represents a user's profile on the api.
User.title: User

old_password.description: Old password should be passed as a validation parameter.

deposit_id.description: Id for the deposit that was created.

entries.description: List of account history items for the user

UserGetPortfolioHistoryRequest.description: Request for fetching user portfolio history

max_date.description:
Restricts the response to orders before a timestamp
in: query

max_ts.description:
Restricts the response to orders before a timestamp in unix seconds, overrides max_date
in: query

min_date.description:
Restricts the response to orders after a timestamp
in: query

min_ts.description:
Restricts the response to orders after a timestamp in unix seconds, overrides min_date
in: query

count.description: Specifies how many contracts should be bought

expiration_unix_ts.description: Specifies the expiration time of the order, in unix seconds.  If this is not supplied, or is 0, the order won't expire.

market_id.description: Specifies the id of the market for this order

sell_position_capped.description: Specifies whether the order place count should be capped by the members current position.

side.description: Specifies if this is a 'yes' or 'no' order

status.description: Status of the order submit operation

reduced_by.description: Status of the order submit operation

UserTrade.description:
Represents a trade from the user perspective.

A trade is created whenever an order is fully or partially matched, so there can be multiple trades with the same order_id.
It is guaranteed that the sum of the count field for all the trades with the same order_id field shouldn't exceed the place_count on the order.
UserTrade.title: UserTrade

country_code.description: User's phone country code. Should be 1 for now because only USA accounts are accepted.

withdrawal_id.description: Id for the withdrawal that was created.

Watchlist.description: Watchlist is the list of markets that you have some activity on, this is used mostly by the UI.
Watchlist.title: Watchlist
